name: Hilton London Hyde Park

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What should you expect of a 4 star hotel in London when you are paying a very low price through a last minute (don't know hotel until booked) deal? Well, you certainly don't expect the executive suite but you don't expect a grim room either- there should be no grim rooms in a 4-star hotel. However, grim room is what we got.
reviews.title: Never, never accept Room 224!

likes.disliked: — Room 224 and the general feeling of no star accommodation in a so-called 4 star hotel

reviews.title: Better than the reviews
reviews.text: Beware Room 224 - never, never accept it! I asked for only one thing from my budget-price room - as quiet as possible. The deputy manager gave me such a spiel - no view (definitely right - rubbish on fire escape - view so bad they covered the windows with non-see through film!) but , he said, very quiet - indeed he slept in that part of the hotel when he needed to stay overnight.

Is this man deaf? We were (I think) over the lift shaft of Queensway tube station. So, from 5.45 am until after midnight you could have assumed that the TWO lifts were in the room with you, so loud was the noise and so constant. I asked to change rooms but was punished by being offered a poky room which you could barely move around. I got the message - and
reviews.title: Mediocre hotel with small rooms and mildewed shower

reviews.text: as we were there for 4 days I took the noise and bought earplugs - which I needed all the time when we did not have the TV on to drown the noise.
reviews.title: Quality and Comfort dont live up to expectations of a pricey kensington

likes.liked: — Its position in London and being close to tube
likes.disliked: — Didnt meet expectations set by its website, including views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plus points? Well, the room was relatively large, there was a flat screen TV and the chambermaid kept it as clean as she could. HOWEVER, it was scruffy (chair just about to get a hole in the upholstery, bath grimy around plug, grout coming away around the bath, cracked tiles on bathroom floor) and the flat screen TV showed only Channels 1-5 and Sky News.
reviews.title: Dissapointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was ideal for a sight seeing vacation in London. It sits on the Bayswater tube station (Red line) and the Yellow/Green line station is a short walk. The street of Bayswater is a bit of a tourist street but did not feel unsafe. The service at the hotel was very good - we had trouble one night with a bad A/C in the room but was moved to another room the following night for the rest of our stay without a problem. We had breakfast included and the meal was good each morning. The hotel is not really in the downtown shopping or theater area but is a short tube ride away to either location. The hotel was a fairly good price performance but still a little expensive - (most places are in Londan). I would stay here again - I would recommend the hotel as a median priced hotel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location, good service

reviews.text: Great location for getting around London on the tube. Queensway tube station on the Cental line just steps from the front door.
reviews.title: Great location, Accomodating staff

likes.disliked: — Too many types of rooms. No unifromity.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Receptionist was very helpful in a complicated arrangement of four rooms some of which were paid for with breakfasts included and one dinner others were Hilton Honors rewards with breakfast for some of the days etc.. She took the time to get it right when we checked in.
reviews.title: Good Hotel - Great Location

reviews.text: Good breakfast buffet statisfied hungry teenager as well as parents. Really good orange juice.
reviews.title: Great Position

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are varied. room 223 too small with a set of steps inside the door and no place for more than one carryone on the floor. Room 410 very nice. Double paned windows on Bayswater cut the sound nicely. Rooms overlooking Queensway had some traffic noise.
reviews.title: great location, good food , great hotel

likes.disliked: — noise of the traffic outside window

reviews.text: This hotel should not be a Hilton hotel. The rooms are very small (even for London standards) and very hot. When I arrived in my room all lights were out, the TV was on and the heating was put to the highest temperature. The windows cannot be opened.
reviews.title: Should not be a Hilton hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At 2AM in the night the fire alarm went off. It was totally unclear for me and some other guests what to do and what was happening. The next day I heard that it was a technical error.
reviews.title: Loved the Hilton Hyde Park and recommend it

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, clean and comfortable room, location, view to Hyde Park

reviews.text: The staff is not very friendly and hard to understand because of their (East European?) accent.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Location

reviews.text: I really don't advice you to stay here, there are better places in London to stay for the same price (it is not a very cheap hotel)
reviews.title: Great Location, but not a typical Hilton experience

likes.liked: — Location was great - near two Tube stops
likes.disliked: — Small rooms, but typical of Europe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked and paid for the hotel on the website months before our trip. Our stay included a special rate with breakfast and dinner included on the first night.
reviews.title: Good Hotel for London

reviews.text: My mum booked this hotel recently for our three day trip to London Which was a slightly early birthday treat. I have to admit from reading the previous reviews before I went I was a bit aprehensive, but I really don't know why people are rating it so bad....and I can be quite fussy.
reviews.title: Pleasently surprised!

likes.liked: — The location- very convenient for nearby tube access, shops, restaurants, scenic walks.
likes.disliked: — Not being able to put the air conditioning up higher- hot stuffy rooms at night.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was adequate enough (stayed on 5th floor)- nice decor, good lighting, bath/shower, ample storage space for belongings, comfy beds, iron/ironing board, safe, tv, hairdryer, complementary refreshments, toiletries, daily papers. They were cleaned to a high standard and there was ample enough space to move around our twin bedroom aswell. The staff were friendly and helpful and the meals which we had included as a special price deal were really good. It certainly worked out cheaper than eating out all the time.
reviews.title: Average Hotel at best

reviews.text: Breakfast consisted of a huge choice..full english cooked breakie, toast and pastries/cakes, fruit salad, cereals, tea, coffee, juice. Dinner you had a choice off a menu (starter/main course/desert all fullfilling/nicely displayed) and there was enough options for vegetarians and other dietary requirements.
reviews.title: I really like this hotel, but you have to work a bit...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only two gripes were that the room did get very stuffy and quite hot at nights and we was unable to change the air conditioning control..but having the window open slightly helps as does bringing along some vics vapor rub,lol. The noise out the front tends to quiten down considerably around 2am even at wkends. Also even though there was a shower curtain the bathroom floor still got slightly flooded so it's advisable to put a towel down (a few supplied already) .
reviews.title: Not up to Hilton standards, but convienent.

likes.disliked: — Room size and out of date bath.

reviews.text: The hotel in itself is good value and is especially close by to a couple of tube stations, lovely parks, shops, restaurants all of which is very handy. Sure in a few places it could do with a lick of paint or the carpeting washed but nothing was that bad. After all one doesn't come to London to be holed up in their hotel all the time do they?
reviews.title: A horrible hotel.

aka: Hilton London Hyde Park Hotel London
description: Step outside the Hilton London Hyde Park hotel to enjoy the delights of London's favourite Royal Park. Feast on international cuisine in The Dining Room restaurant at the Hilton London Hyde Park hotel or drop by the Library Lounge bar for a nightcap. The Hilton London Hyde Park hotel is 1 mile from Oxford Street and the West End. Hire a pedalo at the Serpentine boating lake in Hyde Park, right outside the hotel. 35 minutes' drive from Heathrow Airport, the Hilton London Hyde Park hotel offers 2 meeting rooms for 2-100 and a business centre. From Hilton Rooms to Deluxe Rooms, all guest rooms have high-speed internet access.
